content.description: Crux at the top follows a thin, sharp crack with small feet.  Great climbing!
content.location: Route to the left of the dihedral.

content.description: Really great rock on the upper section is marred by a chossy band of crumbly rock at the small bulge.  The line is aesthetically attractive with a sweet double-mantel move at the finish.  Most of the holds on the lower section can be trusted more than they look, but be careful.  This could become a truly excellent route with more traffic.
content.location: 2nd route from the left and left of the obvious dihedral climb.

climbs.name: Give Me Fire
climbs.fa: Jimmy F, Luked, ClarkO, Duncan M, 10/2010

content.description: With a start that is harder than it looks and an unexpectedly challenging crux near the top as you climb over the bulge onto the reddish rock, this route just keeps on giving! Be careful of loose rock, but this route should clean up well.
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall.  Left of a large separated slab.

content.description: Anything but serene, this route has very loose rock for the first three bolts and crumbles like hard cheese.  Be careful!  The upper section may make the lower section worth the climb, though.
content.location: Next route to the right of the obvious dihedral, about 30'.

content.description: Really beautiful line up the obvious dihedral.  Bring gear if your prefer!  The roof at the end looks harder than it is, go for it and hope your hips are flexible enough to stem!!  perhaps the most visually appealing line on the face.
content.location: The bolts go up the left face of the dihedral to a big roof at the top.

content.description: Interesting climbing through bands of alternating good and suspect rock.
content.location: Leftmost route on this section of the wall, 2 routes left of obvious dihedral.

content.description: Solid route with predictable feet. Cruxy start and finish.
